channel.title: Geometry Proofs?!?!?1 help!
channel.description:
okay for the first one: Given: Two triangles ^ABC and ^ABD standing on a desktop F ___ ___ BC congruent to BD <ABC congruent to <ABD ___ ____ Prove:AC is congruent to AD Picture: [img]http://i748.photobucket.com/albums/xx122/izanamairsps/1geo.jpg[/img]
2. Given: ___ ___ EK is congruent to HJ ___ ___ KG is congruent to JF ___ ___ EF is congruent to HG Prove: <E is congruent to <H
Picture:[img]http://i748.photobucket.com/albums/xx122/izanamairsps/2geo.jpg[/img]
3. Given: (circle with dot in middle) O <R is congruent to <V ___ ___ PO is congruent to OW Prove: ___ ___ TP is congruent to TW
Picture:[img]http://i748.photobucket.com/albums/xx122/izanamairsps/3geo.jpg[/img]
PLease Help ME!!!!!

item.title: Geometry Proofs?!?!?1 help!
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“oksuper_, post:9, topic:319852”]#1 - sas postulate m8; ab ~ ab by reflexive prop, bc ~ bd by given, abc ~ abd by given, then corr parts of ~ triangles are ~
#2 - fg ~ fg by reflexive prop, then use def of between and addition prop to get eg ~ fh, then sss theorem, followed by corr parts of ~ triangles are ~
#3 - introduce altitude to; def of altitude means perpendicular, get right angles top, tow, all right angles are congruent to get top ~ tow, and then reflexive for to ~ to… sas postulate then corr parts of ~ triangles are ~[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 24, 2009, 05:43:58 pm[/size][hr][quote author=ownagesbot link=topic=416310.msg3067565#msg3067565 date=1261332755]

for the first one 2 sides and an angle in between them are the same. By SAS, both triangles are congruent. Therefore ac = ad

for the second one, by SSS the triangles are congruent so that angle must be the same

Hint for the third: draw an altitude
[/quote]How do you even remember that stuff, ive not done this shit for years

it’s called actually learning the material[/quote]
umm sure but even if you learn it its pretty hard to remember it like 8 years after learning it

Read full topic

item.title: Geometry Proofs?!?!?1 help!
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

#1 - sas postulate m8; ab ~ ab by reflexive prop, bc ~ bd by given, abc ~ abd by given, then corr parts of ~ triangles are ~
#2 - fg ~ fg by reflexive prop, then use def of between and addition prop to get eg ~ fh, then sss theorem, followed by corr parts of ~ triangles are ~
#3 - introduce altitude to; def of altitude means perpendicular, get right angles top, tow, all right angles are congruent to get top ~ tow, and then reflexive for to ~ to… sas postulate then corr parts of ~ triangles are ~[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 24, 2009, 05:43:58 pm[/size][hr][quote=“ownagesbot, post:7, topic:319852”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=416310.msg3066342#msg3066342 date=1261251962]
for the first one 2 sides and an angle in between them are the same. By SAS, both triangles are congruent. Therefore ac = ad

for the second one, by SSS the triangles are congruent so that angle must be the same

Hint for the third: draw an altitude
[/quote]How do you even remember that stuff, ive not done this shit for years[/quote]

it’s called actually learning the material
